body_html: Just saying that keepdims - although being used in numpy - is just a really bad name and keep_dimensions or keep_dims (if you insist on non-obvious abbreviations) is much better readable (which I would give the highest priority in an API). I would rather keep the good name, and try to change the numpy parameter.
body_text: Just saying that keepdims - although being used in numpy - is just a really bad name and keep_dimensions or keep_dims (if you insist on non-obvious abbreviations) is much better readable (which I would give the highest priority in an API). I would rather keep the good name, and try to change the numpy parameter.
body: Just saying that `keepdims` - although being used in numpy - is just a really bad name and `keep_dimensions` or `keep_dims` (if you insist on non-obvious abbreviations) is much better readable (which I would give the highest priority in an API). I would rather keep the good name, and try to change the numpy parameter.
